message.content: This question requires knowledge about common sources of pollution. Option (A), cars, is a known source of air pollution due to the emissions produced by their engines. Oceans (option B) and glaciers (option C) are natural bodies of water and are not sources of pollutants themselves. Storms (option D) may cause temporary environmental disruptions, but they are not sources of pollutants.

This question requires knowledge about sources of pollution. Cars are a significant source of air pollution, as they emit pollutants such as carbon monoxide, nitrogen oxides, and particulate matter. Option (B) is incorrect because while oceans can be polluted by human activities, they themselves are not a direct source of pollution. Option (C) is incorrect because glaciers do not produce pollutants. Option (D) is incorrect because storms are natural weather events and do not produce pollutants on their own.

This question requires basic knowledge about sources of pollutants. Option (A), cars, is a common source of air pollution due to the emission of exhaust gases and particulate matter. Option (B), oceans, is incorrect because oceans are not sources of pollutants, but rather bodies of water that can be polluted by human activities. Option (C), glaciers, is incorrect because glaciers are not sources of pollutants, but they can be contaminated by pollutants from the air or through human activities. Option (D), storms, is incorrect because storms are weather events and not sources of pollutants themselves, although they can transport and disperse pollutants in the environment.

Cars release emissions such as carbon monoxide, nitrogen oxides, and particulate matter into the air, contributing to air pollution. Option (B) is incorrect because oceans themselves are not a source of pollutants, but rather can be affected by pollution from other sources. Option (C) is incorrect because glaciers are primarily made up of ice and do not produce pollutants. Option (D) is incorrect because storms are weather phenomena and not sources of pollution.
